thread.title: Arsenal news: Arsenal training on plastic pitch ahead of Sutton United FA Cup tie | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Arsenal training on plastic pitch ahead of Sutton United FA Cup tie | Metro News

author: Coral Barry For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Arsenal training on plastic pitch ahead of Sutton United FA Cup tie | Metro News
text:
Coral Barry for Metro.co.uk Sunday 19 Feb 2017 11:36 pm Sutton United play on a 3G pitch (Picture: Getty) 
Arsenal have been training on a pitch similar to the one they will be playing on when they take on non-league side Sutton United on Monday night. Theo Walcott left red-faced as Arsenal fans slam club for 'disrespectful' gesture 
Sutton is the second of the non-league minnows to play Premier League opposition in the latest round of the FA Cup and are hoping to join Lincoln City in the quarter-finals. 
Arsenal have been preparing for the unfamiliar pitch surface by training indoors on a plastic surface this week. 
‘The dangers are first of all the pitch, secondly their enthusiasm and thirdly that we are not ready for a big fight and subconsciously think that they are a non-league team and it is no matter,’ said Wenger. Arsenal trainjed outdoors on Sunday ahead of the game (Picture: Getty) 
‘That will not happen. 
‘Sutton, I have heard, have a wet pitch which they water before the game and is quicker. 
‘The weight on the joints is different and you cannot slide to block every time so it makes football a bit different. Sutton will be hopeful the unfamiliar pitch surface will work in their favour (Picture: Getty) Arsene Wenger insist there will be no surprises (Picture: Getty) 
‘The ball comes to you suddenly and accelerates and does not slow down like in a normal game.’ 
Premier League sides rarely get the chance to play on 3G pitches as they are thought to increase the chances of injury. Ex-Arsenal player Craig Eastmond will play on Monday (Picture: Getty)
